document_data.name: Crypt Cat
document_data.mainbody: '''Crypt cats''' were a type of [[undead]] created from mummified [[cat]]s to guard burial chambers.
document_data.Description:
Crypt cats had dry, shrunken bodies with mangy clumps of fur that had dry [[clay]] clinging to it. Their teeth were yellow and often broken, while their eyes were mere husks in gaping sockets.

These creatures were often fitted with expensive pieces of [[jewelry]], such as a [[gold]]en [[bell]] or a [[ring]] through the ear.
document_data.Abilities:
Crypt cats were immune to ''[[charm]]'' effects, ''[[hold monster]]'', ''[[sleep]]'', and [[death magic]]. They were immune to [[poison]]s. And they could not be [[turn undead|turned]] while in the presence of a more powerful undead master, unless said master was also turned.

Those attacked by a crypt cat could potentially be afflicted with a [[disease]], which manifested as a red inflammation around where one was wounded. Said wound could not be healed until the afflicted had either the [[spell]] ''[[cure disease]]'' or ''[[heal]]'' cast upon them.
document_data.Combat: These creatures fought with their claws and fangs. They would fight to the death in order to protect their master.
document_data.History:
Over time as [[Myth Glaurach]]'s [[mythal]] decayed, its fertility effect on cats became corrupted, making it so that any feline killed within its confines would arise as a free-willed crypt cat.{{Cite web/Mintiper's Chapbook/Part 5}}

In [[1375 DR]], a group of [[adventurer]]s discovered some crypt cats within the tomb of the [[Netherese]] scholar [[Augathra the Mad]].

Ecology.Creation:
Crypt cats were created by coating the corpse of a cat with a thin layer of clay containing magical salves and oils. The feline used could be of any species and while larger species were sometimes used, it was typically the domestic variety that was made into crypt cats. The exact composition of the clay was unknown, though some assumed that high-level necromantic spells were involved.

Once their body dried it was painted in brilliant colors to mimic the cat's fur pattern.
Ecology.Habitats: Beyond the [[Prime Material plane]], these creatures could be found in the [[Domains of Dread]].
Ecology.Relationships:
Cults that worshiped cats were known to create this kind of undead.

Besides guarding tombs, crypt cats were sometimes used as minions by intelligent [[undead]].
